channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dog fouling, 3rd February
item.description:
The fenced off children’s play area, commonly called the football pitch. Dog fouling. Some is using the children’s playground as a dog toilet. I’ve also noticed dog fouling around the whole block, along Green Hundred Road. Every couple of metres there is dog mess. This is a new issue. We very rarely see dog fouling along this street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Friary Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging trees onto 1 Ludlow Close, 3rd February
item.description:
Hello, I have a customer at 1 Ludlow Close, BR2 0YG who has a council owned Hornbeam and Maple overhanging his garden, from a council verge on Queen Anne Avenue. He wants to enlist my services to prune them back (in accordance with BS3998); i just need permission. Best wishes, Matthew Trantom, Panacea Gardens
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aylesbury Road, Shortlands, Greater London

item.title: Long-term stagnant and polluted water in Albion Channel causing algae build-up, odour, and concern for wildlife., 3rd February
item.description:
The water in the Albion Channel has been stagnant for over a year and is now covered with a thick green carpet of algae. Large amounts of rubbish have been thrown into the channel, and cut grass has been left in the water to decay. At times there is a strong smell. Ducks and other birds are regularly seen swimming through the polluted water, which is very distressing and raises serious concerns about their health and safety. Given the condition of the channel, there may also be dead birds or other wildlife present. The situation appears to be worsening and urgently needs inspection and clean-up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-11, Wolfe Crescent, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown weeds, 3rd February
item.description:
There are overgrown weeds on West Parkside but it is particularly bad on the corner between West Parkside and Southern Way (photos). It hasn’t been taken care of for almost a year! The trash situation there is also very bad. Please attend and remove litter and de-weed the whole of West Parkside

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southern Way, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wait button constantly extinguishes, 3rd February
item.description:
The pedestrian sensor above the lights is constantly losing detection of pedestrians resulting in the pedestrian push button light extinguishing and the lights not changing. This is adding considerable delay to the time taken to cross the road and therefore many people are not waiting. This is on the non-DLR station side of the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Woolwich Road, Silvertown, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavilion paving sign and litter by telephone box, 3rd February
item.description:
Hello I reported this last week and the litter snd signage on the lamppost in the Broadway opposite Avenue Road is still there. In fact the litter has been there 2 weeks, surely it doesnt take a week to remove? I received a notification but nothing has been addressed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Pickford Lane, Welling, Bexleyheath, Greater London
